title: trouble with dotted font
content:
hello,

when i was testing my new font, i discovered a funny phenomenon:  
the printing shows some of the glyphs more bold than others, but in fontlab they are all equal.  
also at certain sizes it’s certain letters (image: E, M, Q etc), at other sizes it’s other letters that look bold.

i thought maybe the printers just can't handle the amount of curves.

what do you think?

best,  
marcus

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019022317im_/http:/typophile.com/files/trouble_5054.gif)
author: marcus sterz

comments.content: This is Hinting most probably. But also make sure all your glyphs have single outlines.

thank for you comment!

the outlines are not the problem – they look ok.

what kind of hinting would you suggest?  
does it even make sense to make hinting for a font like this?

i double- and triple-checked the path direction already. also there are no double outlines.

:((((

still the printing shows the same mistakes  
(the image above shows a scan of the postscript-print, on the screen everything is fine)
